runs.comm: on a good length and on the stumps, Thirimanne prods across and defends it towards mid-on
tad fuller and on the stumps, Thirimanne pushes it to the right of mid-on and sets off for a quick single
swing and a miss from Dilshan, went chasing after a full ball that nipped away, doesn't connect with the drive
Starc keeps it very full and well outside off, Dilshan looks to steer it towards third man, the ball beats the outside edge
fraction too short and on Dilshan's pads, worked wide of mid-on for a single
on a good length and just outside off, Thirimanne defends it with an open face
tries to get away this length delivery off the pads with an attempted flick off the pads, but is late on it
much better from Dilshan, tad fuller and just outside off, he gets half-forward and pushes it back past the bowler, the timing isn't spot on but the batsmen run well and get back for the third run
tucks away this length delivery on middle and leg towards the leg side

bowls a fantastic back of a length outside of off which cramps Lahiru for space, with the extra bounce catching the outside edge of his bat to fly over to the keeper behind, who snaps it up gleefully. Australia pick up one early as Sri Lanka look to mow down this huge chase
short of a length outside of off which is allowed to go through to the keeper
shortish length which Sangakkara is able to get on top off as the over comes to a close
looks to crash Starc through the covers, but is late on this as it just nibbles away from the outside edge of his bat. Got great carry across the batsman there
manages to get away a thick outside edge through third man as he looked to target the covers once more
defends this back of a length at the top of the bounce, and close to his body
huge "oooh" goes across the ground as he delivers this slightly back of a length which just straightens as it rushes past Sanga's bat
shortish length tailing down leg which is tucked away by Sangakkara quite competently
glances away this back of a length off the hips to end the over
length on middle and leg which is defended away to the leg side by Dilshan
fires in a ful, wide delivery outside off which arrives slower than his missiles before as Dilshan digs this one away to the off side
gets away a drop single through mid-off to bring Sangakkara on strike
jabs away this slightly back of a length through extra-cover as they are able to return for the second after hustling through the first run
shortish length which Sangakkara is able to manipulate through backward square with a rather awkward pull that just makes it away. Not the most convincing shot, but it got the result he wanted
fires in a pacey delivery on middle and leg which raps the top of Sangakkara's pads as he looked to glance away the delivery, but there was a definite inside-edge. Sent that in at 149kph!
searching for the slightly wide yorker as he offers up a low full toss which Dilshan fails to punish away through the covers
now flicks away the pacer behind of square on the leg side for a brace
fuller length, going across Dilly, as this one is sent away to the close-in fielder on the leg side
delivers a shortish length which Dilshan looked to climb into as he went for the hook, but thankfully this one lands safe around deep fine leg as there were no fielders in the vicinity
pitches one up on middle and off which is struck back to him on his follow through
eases away this fuller delivery through long off as they run a couple
overpitched from Mitch as this one is driven through long off quite comfortably for a boundary
and again, this time straighter from Dilshan, as he pays the price once more for delivering in the slot
makes it three in a row as he raises the roof at the SCG with a heave to this fuller delivery on off, sending this high over deep midwicket before it landed at the rope after a couple of bounces
Dilshan is taking on Mitchell at the SCG as he pulls this shortish length from the left-arm pacer over backward square to make it four in four. Really got that one out of the screws.

Mitchell is being taken to the cleaners here as he smokes away this overpitched length outside off through the covers for a boundary. Has already taken 20 from the over, and there is still a delivery to go. Mitchell just turns back and heads to his bowling mark

Dilshan makes it six in a row as he initially looked to play at this fuller delivery before noticing the change of pace to adjust his shot as he pushed at the length to get it away to the extra-cover boundary. The outfield makes sure this reaches the target in the end
a huge cheer rings across the ground as Sangakkara appears to have pushed this length delivery through the gap at extra-cover, but is pulled back before the rope
Dilshan is putting on a master-class as he plays his treasured 'Dilscoop' to this length delivery on middle and leg, which he sends through fine leg with the paddle
gets down the wicket now as he tries to crash away a boundary through long on, with the keeper collecting the take from behind
tries to be cute again with a straight ramp over the keeper, but instead gets struck on the helmet as the ball ends up near short third man. Lucky to escape with his head, literally, there
Sangakkara feeling a bit left out now as he slaps away this length delivery just behind of square on the off side for a boundary
calmly dabs away a single towards third man to end another good over for Sri Lanka
just oozes class as he drives on the up to this back of a length outside off as he finds the sweeper cover boundary with panache
now looking to guide this fuller one on middle and leg through mid-on, but picks out the fielder
misses out on this overpitched delivery outside off, as he locates the man at mid-off with an ill-timed drive
shortish length which doesn't quite carry to Sangakkara as he played on top of the bounce, with this one crashing into his stomach after the miss
slips in an almost-yorker length outside off which shapes in to Haddin as it passes the base of the stumps. Sangakkara was late on this attempted drive to the ball
lasers away a drive to this overpitched delivery, but picks out short cover right away
straddling on the pads as Dilshan is able to flick this away to deep backward square
drives this overpitched delivery to the man at mid-off, with the ball hitting his knee as he put in the sliding dive to get behind this. In the end, mid-on is able to recover the ball
turned away off middle and leg towards midwicket for one
works away this back of a length going across towards the leg side
nudges away a run to the leg side as Dilshan hares to the other end as the ball struggled away on the leg side
Sangakkara looking for the chip through extra-cover, as he hits this one just wide of Clarke at the position, who has to run to his right to fetch this
glances away this length delivery off the pads through midwicket
drills this fuller length going across to the man at short mid-off
slow bouncer going across which is penalised in the end by Ian Gould after some deliberation
dabs away a single through third man to get to the other end
full and on the pads as this is flicked away behind of square on the leg side
tries to dig out this yorker from Starc fired in outside off. Was well late on this attempt
goes round the wicket now as Dilshan drives away this fuller length to the man at cover
steers away this one flighted in on middle and leg through long on
driven back to the bowler in his follow through
sensibly drives away this Doherty special through long off for one

comes down the track to this one tossed up just outside off as he drives away through extra-cover, with Clarke doing well to get a hand to it at cover, before it is eventually pulled back before the rope
works with the angle to tickle this down fine leg for a brace
shimmies down now before readjusting to clip this away through square-leg
given plenty of flight as this one is struck away towards deep extra-cover
continues round the wicket as this one is turned away behind of square on the leg side
content to just tuck the bowler on the leg side for a comfortable single
eases away the spinner towards deep extra-cover
plays at this one tossed up on middle as he looked to get away a dab-and-run on the off side
advances down the track before driving this past the bowler to long off
content to just rotate strike as Clarke has succeeded in giving as little pace as possible to these two
tries to force away a slice through backward point, but is held by the fielder

given opportunity to rock onto the back foot to cut away this slightly short delivery towards deep point, with Maxwell the fielder firing in a hard throw to Haddin when he saw the second run being taken on, but the dive from Dilshan is able to get him home in the end

dropped the Australian captain hands Dilshan a life as the right-hander looked to slog-sweep over cow corner, with this going high over midwicket. Clarke, who was running backwards and to his left, is unable to hold onto the take after going for the dive
Sangakkara able to guide away a run through cover to get Dilshan back on stroke
sensibly pushes at this delivery sliding down leg towards mid-on, but is not keen to take the single
tries to work away a single through cover, but to no avail
another attempt through the same region is met with a similar result
gets to the milestone as he helps himself through deep fine leg with this paddle. Gets him to the 14,000 run-mark, which is met with lots of Sri Lankan flags and cheers from this exuberant crowd
now goes for the calculated strike over cow corner, which he is able to get wide of long on to find the boundary

gets deep in his crease before finessing this past backward point, who is unable to stop this despite the dive, as the outfield takes care of the rest. Timed that away so late off the bat, but it achieves the desired result. Pure class from Sanga
just bunts away this one on a shorter length to the leg side to end the over
Dilshan, who is now helmet-less, cuts away this slightly short delivery outside his off stump for a single

Sangakkara has an easy push at this Doherty slider going across him, with Haddin collecting this as it rushed past the bat and whipped off the bails when he thinks he sees Sangakkara overbalancing a touch, but replays confirm that the left-hander has his foot in place behind the crease
waltzes down before clipping away the bowler through square-leg, with the pressure from the batsmen putting the fielder off in the deep as he failed to pickup the ball on the first instance
eases away a single now square off the wicket as he brings up his third consecutive fifty-plus score of the tournament. This is now his 94th half-century in ODIs. What a legend
defended by Dilshan to the off side
works away the spinner to long off to keep the strike
tries to sweep away this leg-side delivery, but is far too early on it
steers away a run through square-leg as Dilshan reaches his fifty too
defended by the batsman
nurdles away a single through square-leg to get off the strike
Maxwell may have seen Dilshan positioning himself early for the reverse sweep as he fires one down leg, which Dilshan is unable to get any bat on as this continues through fine leg for byes
this time gets away a single with a swipe towards square-leg
works away a run on the off side as they switch ends
sliding one on a flatter trajectory as Sangakkara opts for the late cut through backward point which is reined in before the boundary
targets the vacant space at cow corner as he gets low to slog-sweep, which he connects beautifully to find the rope after one bounce
gets away a single now through backward square to bring Dilly on strike
Dilshan gives the strike back to his partner with a drive towards the covers
comes down the track and lifts Doherty over mid-off for yet another valuable boundary as the players break for drinks
tries to glide away this short of a length through backward point, but is unable to do so so when he picks out the fielder behind of square
shortish length which is clubbed away rather rashly to the leg side for one
tries to guide one past Smith at point, who puts in an athletic dive to intercept this
dabs away a run through third man to get off the strike
tucks away this delivery off the pads through to the long leg fielder
pushes at this fuller length outside of off which finds its way to mid-off
fails to pick a single on the off side behind of square
looks to nurdle a run through the leg side now, but is unable to find the desired space
lofts the bowler now straight over his head as this one lands safely near long on
cut away off the back foot towards the deep cover fielder
drags this one across Dilshan, affording him enough width to power this away through backward point for four
straying on the pads as this is clipped away for a single to the leg side
back-of-the-hand slower ball which Dilshan fails to pick as he looked for the clip off the pads
length delivery on the pads which is tucked away behind of square
on a good length and well outside off. Driven straight to the fielder at point
back-of-the-hand slower ball from Faulkner which almost gets the wicket as Sangakkara was early in closing the face of the bat, which ends up getting a leading edge towards third man
fuller length delivery and on Dilshan's pads which is turned straight to the fielder at square leg
another slower back-of-the-hand delivery from Faulkner. Dilshan dabs it straight to backward point as he wants a single, but is sent back
fires in a fuller length outside of off which is struck straight to the close-in fielder on the off side
delivers a fuller length which is struck back to him in his follow through
looks for some space on the leg-side, but is unable to locate any
continues to operate this slightly back of a length line on middle and leg as this is glanced away through the leg side
goes round the wicket now to Dilshan as he sends in a fuller length which Dilshan tried to get away, but fails to do so
tries him with a shorter one which Dilshan fails to put away with a hook through backward square. Still run the single though as this lands somewhere on the leg side
looking to force away a glide through backward point, but is stopped by the fielder in question
slower, full delivery, which goes across Dilshan as he fails to get away this late cut

Faulkner raps Dilshan right on middle and off as he plays all around this one. Goes up straightaway for the appeal, which the umpire corroborates soon after. Dilshan wants the review though after consulting with Sangakkara at the other end. It was another back-of-the-hand slower ball which definitely hit in line as there are four reds across the screen. Dilshan has to go, much to the delight of the Sydney crowd. Has been an excellent firestarter of a knock to get Sri Lanka's chase off on the best possible foot
slower, back of the length, which Mahela just fends away towards the off side

able to get to the other end, but only just, as he pushes away at this length delivery towards mid-on, before the fielder picked up and took a shy at the non-striker's, with Mahela well short of his ground. Would have been a horrible way to go if that had struck
picks up a single through midwicket to keep the strike
looks to guide this fuller one from Johnson past the bowler, but mid-on has Mitch's back
slipping down the leg side now as Sangakkara is able to tickle this one away through fine leg for four. Called leg byes by the umpire in the end
another full delivery on and around leg which is struck away to the close-in fielder on the leg side
slower yorker on middle and leg which is struck away to the same fielder as the previous delivery
overpitched as this one is driven straight past Mitchell, with the protection at mid-on doing well to dive and cut this off at the ring
short of a length which is tucked away to the leg side by Mahela
short of a length and just outside off as this one is dabbed straight to the fielder at backward point
full delivery straying on the pads which is flicked away uppishly towards deep midwicket
overpitched on middle and leg as Mahela just clips this away aerially through midwicket to find the boundary. With no one in the deep near there, turns out to be a very safe option
negotiates this change-up slower ball from Faulkner which goes across him
back-of-the-hand, loopy slower ball which is flicked away through backward square
eases away this leg-side slanting delivery off the pads to long leg
fails to pickup a single on the leg side as he locates the man at silly mid-on
looks to get a single off the pads, but is unable to time it away effectively
tests out his modified helmet with a nasty bouncer outside of off which Sangakkara chooses not to engage with
pitches this one up on middle and leg as Sangakkara locates the man at silly mid-on
tries to get away a single square off the wicket as he initially went down for the other end, but is sent back by Mahela when he sees the man behind square run towards the ball
leg-side delivery which is flicked away off the pads to the fielder at long leg
flighted delivery which is fended away to the leg side
eases away a single off the pads to deep midwicket
turns away a single on the leg side to get Sangakkara on strike
caresses away a comfortable single to deep extra-cover
gets in a good stride as this one is fended away to the off side
looks to get this one away through backward square as Mahela keeps the strike
picks up a single down the leg side with ease
bissects the gap at deep midwicket with this pickup shot that beats the dive from Watson, who was steaming in from cow corner
tries to force away a drive on the off side, but pinpoints mid-off
looks to slap away through cover point as he once again locates the fielder inside of the ring
shanks this one darted in on and around off as the close-in fielder picks up the ball on the bounce
tries to slap away a single through extra-cover, but is held by the fine, fielding effort from Finch
picks out the man at silly mid-on with this drive
tosses this one up on middle and off as they go up for the appeal after Mahela fudges the sweep, but the angle was suggesting this would continue on past off stump
picks up a single with a flick away through backward square
shimmies down to guide this one past the bowler to long off
eases away a single through midwicket to get Sangakkara on strike
Sangakkara gets away with this attempted sweep round the corner, with the ball catching the top edge to fly over the keeper, but luckily, away from any close-in fielders
decides to go after Watson straight away with this slice over to third man
merely pushes at this fuller length outside of off before stealing a single as the ball rolled towards mid-off
looks to drive away on the up, but Warner at backward point keeps him humble
eases away a single on the leg side for one
flicks away this fuller delivery off the pads through square-leg
punches this back of a length straight back to the bowler, but can't pinch the single
fuller length, going across, which is clipped away towards deep midwicket
flicks away this fuller one off the pads behind square on the leg side

Sangakkara looking to release the pressure as he comes down the track to slice away this fuller length over cover, with Maxwell at deep cover running forward unable to reach for this as it fell to the ground. Was a couple of feet away from holing out there
now swivels and pulls this to take this leg-side delivery over the short backward square to find the boundary
that half-chance costing Australia dearly at the moment as he now succeeds at tickling away four runs through fine leg
masterful from Sangakkara as he takes this slightly back of a length outside his off and ramps it over towards backward point to find the boundary after a few bounces
gets a single through fine leg to bring Sangakkara back on strike, much to the delight of the Sri Lankan masses in the crowd
bowls a peach of a delivery just outside of off as Sangakkara played just inside of the line. Dangerously close to nipping out the left-hander there
slips in a fuller delivery which is struck back to the bowler in his follow through
delivers a pearl of a yorker on middle and leg as Sangakkara just about digs this one away. Manages to get away an inside-edge through backward square to pickup a run and move to 99
has a go at this fuller length going across, but is late on it as Haddin completes the take from behind

Mahela takes on the arm of Clarke at mid-off after driving this fuller one from Starc, and has to pay the price as he nails down the stumps at the non-striker's as he looked to usher in Sangakkara to the strike. Was well out of his ground, despite putting in the dive, as he heads back to the pavilion. That could be a major blow to SL's chances as this chase gets into the business end of the innings
gets off the mark right away with a fend behind square to this shortish length going across him

and he becomes the first player in World Cup history to manage three hundreds in a row as he gets away this fuller delivery on the pads through backward square. Has been in magnificent form of late. He knows that he still has plenty of work left to do in this big chase
pick ups a single down fine leg as Mathews gets onto the hot seat
picks up a brace behind square on the leg side to this length delivery on and around leg
delivers the slower ball out of the back of the hand which is clipped away through square-leg by Mathews
backs away to the leg side in hopes of clearing the covers, but the lack of pace from this Faulkner delivery meant he could do not better than bunt this away to the off side
guides away this back of a length towards mid-off
attacks this shortish length outside of off as this is ramped away over backward point
tries to time away a drive to this fuller delivery on middle and leg, but picks out the man at extra-cover
steers away this almost yorker-length delivery through mid-off as Sri Lanka reach 200
digs out this yorker which follows him as the ball ends up near mid-on
able to keep out this yorker on off to end the over
defends away this back of a length delivery going across him
looks to get away a single on the leg side, but is unable to find any space
gets an edge to this attempted drive through mid-off, with the ball flying over towards backward point
fuller delivery straying on the pads as this one is tucked away behind of square

and that may very well be game for Sri Lanka as Kumar finally departs from the middle after looking to go after this Faulkner delivery, which was slipped in at a fuller length, as he ends up slicing over to the man at deep cover, who this time is able to get under it comfortably. There was some hesitation on the part of the fourth umpire to give this as replays show Faulkner just about, and I mean just about, got his foot behind the line. Really was touch and go there, but because a conclusive decision could not be reached, Sangakkara has to go. Has been a fine effort in this stirring chase so far
picks up a single through long off to end a successful over for the Australians
steers away a single to the man at mid-on as the ground has got noticeably quieter since that last wicket
content to just keep this one out from the bowler
eases away a run now on the leg side to bring Chandimal on strike for the first time
just jabs this one back to the bowler in his follow through
goes for the slog sweep through cow corner as Mathews now looks to guide this Sri Lanka chase
able to steer away a single through long off to keep the strike
puts pressure on Watson straightaway as he heaves this length delivery through the covers to find the boundary
looks to guide this one past the bowler now, but ends up hitting it a bit too straight to him
length delivery which is sent high and handsome over midwicket as he is able to pickup a maximum
fuller one which is flicked away through square-leg, as he is able to hustle the first one hard in order to come back for the second
tries to steer away a single through backward point, but is held by the fielder
advances a touch before finding another boundary through backward square to beat the man chasing from deep midwicket to the rope

fetches this one tossed up on middle and off as he looks for the big slog-sweep over midwicket, but ends up getting a top-edge which just carries over Warner, who went for a hop at backward square, before realising this one was sailing over comfortably
now gets back to belt Doherty towards cow corner for four. Excellent start for SL this over
fails to pickup a single on the leg side as he pinpoints the man at mid-on
just about steers one past a diving Doherty to pick out the fielder at long on
shuffles over to the leg side before blitzing an on drive through long on which has no one bothered to chase after it as it makes its way to the rope
Chandimal is proving a star here at the SCG as he now smashes the bowler over cow corner to finish off the over in some style
delivers a length delivery which is played away to the off side by the batsman
sees Mathews backing away a touch as he tried to follow him with a leg-side delivery, but ends up straying too far down the line
a direct hit from Clarke at mid-off would have meant curtains as Mathews hits this one straight to him before barreling to the other end
crashes away a drive through long off to get the captain on strike
able to work away a run towards the leg slip

this time forced away off the back foot through the off side, with this landing at extra-cover, who is able to pickup and fire in a throw at the non-striker's after there was an initial mix-up between the batsmen. Ends up missing the stumps, and with Faulkner there, he is unable to get to the ball and whip off the bails in time of the batsman making his ground
picks up a single through point to retain the strike
greets the left-arm quick with a slap behind of square to find a boundary through third man
flicks away through square-leg now as he is able to pickup a single
Chandimal really riding his luck here as he tries to heave Johnson over midwicket, but ends up falling away within the ring, with this one falling before the fielder could get anywhere near it
looks to send this one out of the ground as Johnson is penalised for this attempted wide yorker. Really shouldn't have been given a wide as Mitch asks the umpire soon after
shifts over to the off stump to try and hook away this shorter delivery through fine leg, but fails to make a connection
now offers a slower, short of a length delivery which Chandimal tries to swat away through midwicket, but is early on it after being deceived by the speed
moves over to his off stump before cutting this shortish length going across fiercely through backward point for a boundary
able to get Chandimal on strike with this swipe away towards the leg side
looks to send this full delivery over cow corner before getting an outside edge which flies over to a vacant third man for four
nudges away a single towards long on as he moves to 42 off 19
miscues this attempt heave over the leg side, with this one finding midwicket in the end
looks to target the deep square-leg boundary, but is lucky that this heave over the region did not fall straight to the fielder
gets this attempted yorker wrong as Chandimal is able to get nice and low to scythe this away through the covers to now move to 46 off 20
misses out on this back of a length going across him
tries to force away a drive through long on, but instead gets away an inside-edge behind of square
short and punished by the batsman as this is pulled away square off the wicket, but he can't find the boundary

Chandimal gets away with this top-edge over long leg as the man at backward square is unable to get to it. Brings up his fifty, which is greeted with great enthusiasm from the SL fans in the crowd. Still looks to be struggling though
gets into position to hook away this delivery on middle and leg towards deep fine leg

somehow pierces the gap between mid-on and midwicket as Starc exercises those long levers of his to put in a dive and pull this back inches from the rope. Excellent effort there to save his team a certain boundary
leg-side delivery which is helped down to deep fine leg
picks up a brace through long on as the odds have stacked again against SL

and now Mathews has to go after going at this shortish length from Watson, with the ball kissing the face as he went in for the attempted hook. Looks like he was surprised by the length as Haddin is able to take this comfortably from behind
steers away Watson on the front foot towards extra-cover
backs away before clattering this short ball high over extra-cover for a boundary
now slams this fuller length over long off. Perera still believes as the equation reduces to 85 off 48
tucks away this length delivery to the leg side

lets loose of the handle as he tried to swat Johnson over midwicket, with this one swirling high over mid-on, with Doherty getting under it safely to complete the catch. Took the pace of this shorter one as Perera threw everything but the kitchen sink at it
able to ease away a single to the off side to immediately get off strike
is well late on this fuller delivery shaping in from outside off stump
short and slipping down leg as the umpire swivels round to signal the scorers
has a go at this fuller one going across again, with this one fired in at 144 kph
keeps out this length delivery on middle and leg as they end up scraping through for the run
short delivery which is attacked by the batsman as the eventual top-edge sends this over to Doherty at third man, who puts in a fine dive before firing in a throw back towards the middle
looks to send this shorter one out of the stadium, but is late on it
another shorter one which is signalled one for the over as the batsman fails to make a connection
clubs away this length delivery slanting down leg as the acres of space means they are able to return for the second to bring up the Sri Lankan 300
looks for the cart over midwicket before offering up a thick outside edge which falls safe through third man for what seems like the umpteenth time today
comes down the track before swatting this away towards the bowler in his follow through
angles in a full delivery on the pads which is flicked away through square-leg
backs away, gets down on one knee, but fails to clear the covers with this attempted scythe
sends one crashing into the stumps of Prasanna, who just played all around this full yorker on middle which just tailed away a touch. Too good for the tail-ender as he walks off to the pavilion
delivers a sharp bouncer which Sachi has no clue about as it flies over his head
continues from round the wicket as Sachi is well late on this fuller delivery which threatens to castle his off stump as it rushes past
clips away this length delivery honing on the pads over towards deep midiwcket
glides away a single through backward point to get off the strike

Faulkner strikes right away for his captain as Tharanga, Sri Lanka's last recognised batsman, has to go after carting this back of a length straight to the man stationed at cow corner, who is able to get under it quite comfortably
slower delivery on and about leg which deceives Sachi
forces away a stroke down to long on to get off the strike
looks to have a go down the ground as he ends up inside-edging this failed bludgeon onto his shoes
delivers another back-of-the-hand slower delivery which has Malinga well early into his shot as he looked to pull this away
continues from round the wicket as he looks to hone in on off, but the slice away from Sachin through third man means he has to have a boundary added to his runs tally
fantastic yorker on middle which is spooned straight up to mid-off to end the game. There is a bit of confusion as to whether Chandimal would re-emerge, but it looks like the game is officially over
